text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a diversified product portfolio and serves over 100,000 end customers across various industries.
text_1_evidence: Littelfuse has thousands and thousands of SKUs and sells its products to >100,000 end customers.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse operates through three reportable segments: Electronics, Transportation, and Industrial.
text_2_evidence: The Company conducts its business through three reportable segments: Electronics, Transportation, and Industrial.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse's core business is surge protection, with a focus on increasing electrification.
text_1_evidence: The very simple pitch for why this is an attractive business is simply the fact that it is a perfect play on increasing levels of electrification.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's products are driven by electrification, energy efficiency, and automation.
text_2_evidence: Across electronics end markets, product demand is largely driven by electrification, energy and power efficiency, automation, connectivity, artificial intelligence, and safety.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a strong management team with long tenure and a focus on capital allocation.
text_1_evidence: The CEO has been with the company for his entire career... most managers have been with the company for a very long time.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management team has significant experience and a focus on strategic acquisitions.
text_2_evidence: The executive officers of the Company are as follows: David W. Heinzmann, President and Chief Executive Officer and member of the Board of Directors Mr: Heinzmann began his career at Littelfuse in 1985 as manufacturing engineer and has held positions of increasing responsibility since that time.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a disciplined approach to capital allocation, focusing on growth investments and M&A.
text_1_evidence: 40% of this FCF is returned to shareholders and 60% is used for M&A.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse targets 5-7% average annual organic sales growth and 5-7% growth from strategic acquisitions.
text_2_evidence: The Company is targeting average annual organic sales growth of 5-7 percent and average annual sales growth from strategic acquisitions of 5-7 percent.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has experienced significant revenue growth over the past decade, driven by acquisitions and organic growth.
text_1_evidence: Littelfuse has tripled its sales over the last decade (2013-2023).
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's net sales decreased by 6.0% in 2023 compared to 2022, primarily due to lower volume in the Electronics segment.
text_2_evidence: Net sales were $2,362.7 million, which decreased by $151.2 million or 6.0% in 2023 compared to 2022 including $0.7 million favorable changes in foreign exchange rates.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management has a strong track record of capital allocation and growth.
text_1_evidence: Since then, the company has completed 15 acquisitions. In the ensuing decade since 2012, Littelfuse has grown its revenue from 668 million to 2,5 billion.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's operating income decreased by 27.9% in 2023 compared to 2022 due to lower gross profit from the Electronics and Transportation segments.
text_2_evidence: Operating income for 2023 was $360.9 million, a decrease of $140.0 million or 27.9% compared to $500.8 million for 2022.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a strong competitive moat due to its extensive product range and brand reputation.
text_1_evidence: It has operated 97 years in this niche and it shows. In addition, this leads to cumulative learning that is very difficult to replicate.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse faces intense competition from larger companies with greater resources.
text_2_evidence: The Company competes on the basis of price, product performance and quality, service, and / or brand name across the industries and markets it serves.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management is focused on long-term growth and shareholder value.
text_1_evidence: The overriding focus for the next five years is accelerating growth our pathway to a larger; stronger and more successful Littelfuse.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management has faced challenges in achieving growth targets due to market conditions.
text_2_evidence: The Company continues to operate in a challenging macro environment, including but not limited to, supply chain disruptions, varying regional dynamics, and some pockets of end market softness.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a strong focus on sustainability and electrification as growth drivers.
text_1_evidence: The very simple pitch for why this is an attractive business is simply the fact that it is a perfect play on increasing levels of electrification.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's products are linked to sustainable applications such as electric vehicles and renewable energy.
text_2_evidence: The Company is positioned within the global sustainability megatrend to enhance our product offering to help empower a sustainable, connected, and safer world.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a disciplined approach to acquisitions, focusing on strategic growth areas.
text_1_evidence: Since then, the company has completed 15 acquisitions.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse has made several strategic acquisitions to enhance its product offerings and market presence.
text_2_evidence: The Company expects to continue to expand its market presence by leveraging its broad, global access and reach with its strong go-to-market strategy via its strategic distribution partnerships and deep OEM relationships.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management has a long tenure and strong loyalty, contributing to its operational stability.
text_1_evidence: This is something that stands out across the enterprise: apart from the CFO (who has been with the company for 9 years so not too bad either), most managers have been with the company for a very long time.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management team has significant experience and a focus on strategic acquisitions.
text_2_evidence: The executive officers of the Company are as follows: David W. Heinzmann, President and Chief Executive Officer and member of the Board of Directors Mr: Heinzmann began his career at Littelfuse in 1985 as manufacturing engineer and has held positions of increasing responsibility since that time.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a strong focus on innovation and R&D to drive growth.
text_1_evidence: The Company employs scientific, engineering, and other personnel to continually improve its existing product lines and to develop new products.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse invests significantly in R&D to support its growth strategy.
text_2_evidence: During fiscal years 2023, 2022, and 2021, the Company expended $102.4 million, $95.6 million, and $65.9 million, respectively, on R&D.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management is focused on maintaining a strong balance sheet and cash flow generation.
text_1_evidence: The Company generates very nice free cash flow.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's net cash provided by operating activities increased in 2023 compared to 2022.
text_2_evidence: Net cash provided by operating activities was $457.4 million for the fiscal year ended December 30, 2023 representing an increase of $37.7 million as compared to the fiscal year ended December 31, 2022.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a diversified customer base with no single customer representing more than 10% of sales.
text_1_evidence: No customer represents more than 10% of sales.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's sales to Arrow Electronics, Inc. accounted for 11.2%, 11.5%, and 10.7% of consolidated net sales in 2023, 2022, and 2021, respectively.
text_2_evidence: Sales to Arrow Electronics, Inc., which were reported in our Electronics, Transportation and Industrial segments, were 11.2%, 11.5% and 10.7% of consolidated net sales in 2023, 2022, and 2021, respectively.

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management is focused on long-term growth and shareholder value.
text_1_evidence: The overriding focus for the next five years is accelerating growth our pathway to a larger; stronger and more successful Littelfuse.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's management has faced challenges in achieving growth targets due to market conditions.
text_2_evidence: The Company continues to operate in a challenging macro environment, including but not limited to, supply chain disruptions, varying regional dynamics, and some pockets of end market softness.

text_1_evidence: The very simple pitch for why this is an attractive business is simply the fact that it is a perfect play on increasing levels of electrification.
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse's products are linked to sustainable applications such as electric vehicles and renewable energy.
text_2_evidence: The Company is positioned within the global sustainability megatrend to enhance our product offering to help empower a sustainable, connected, and safer world.
